direction.raw_text: Oh.   You never told me we had a letter. She starts to wheel herself toward the front of the shop. Through a crack in the door behind which our three are hiding, we see Holmes' eye watching her. The old woman reaches the letter, picks it up, studies the address. Then she hears something, glances toward the open rear door. A horse-drawn wagon with a canvas top is just pulling into the mews. Two CARTERS jump down from the driver's seat, and one of them takes a small bird-cage from the back of the wagon. As they start in through the door, the old woman drops the letter into her lap, wheels herself toward them.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Morning, Duchess.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Morning.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What have you been doing with yourself?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What do you think? Taking dancing lessons. (she stops in front of the cage) How many do you want this time?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Two dozen. He opens the door of the small cage, the bottom of which is covered with newspaper, starts transferring canaries into it from the large cage.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What are they doing with all those canaries? What's going on up there?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Look, Duchess, we don't know -- and we don't want to know.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: When you work for Jonah, it's better not to ask questions. Through the crack in the door behind which he is hidden, we see Holmes' eye studying the small bird cage, as the canaries are being transferred into it. We MOVE IN CLOSE on the small cage, and see the soiled newspaper spread on the bottom. The masthead reads: INVERNESS COURIER.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (counting as he transfers canaries) ... twenty-two, twenty-three, twenty- four. He closes the doors of the cages, picks up the small cage. His companion indicates the letter in the woman's lap.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: How about that letter? Does that go, too?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No. That's going to be picked up in person. She chuckles. The carriers exit into the mews, stash the cage in the back of the wagon, mount the driver's seat.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (to birds) All right, my pretties. Back to sleep you go. See you tomorrow. She pulls the rope and the tarpaulin drops back over the cage. Then she deposits the letter on top of the covered cage, wheels herself out the rear door. As she slides it shut from outside, our trio is revealed in their hiding places behind the door. There is the sound of the chain rattling, the lock snapping, and the squeaky wheels moving off.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (a sigh of relief) I really thought we were done for.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (casually) The art of concealment, my dear Watson, is merely a matter of being in the right place at the right time. They step forward, and through the painted shop window watch the old woman wheel herself down the street.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Did you hear what she said? You really think Emile is going to pick up the letter himself?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It certainly would simplify things, wouldn't it?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (shaking his head) Maildrops and canaries and wheelchairs... And what was all that about Jonah? And what do you suppose they're doing up there? And where is up there?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: My guess would be Scotland.   Inverness, to be more precise.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Inverness?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Didn't you notice the paper at the bottom of their cage? The Inverness Courier. Gabrielle glances casually at the letter the old woman left lying on top of the cage, and her expression changes.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Mr. Holmes! This letter -- (she picks it up)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What about it?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (holding it out to him) It's addressed to you.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . Holmes takes the letter, examines the envelope.    It is indeed addressed to him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Nevertheless -- With the saw-end of his cane, he slits the envelope open, removes the enclosure, unfolds it. We see the letter in his hand as he reads it out loud. The letterhead says: DIOGENES CLUB, St. James's, London.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (reading) My Dear Sherlock: I expect you and Dr. Watson to join me at the club immediately upon reciept of this note. According to my calculations, that should be at 11:40 a.m. Your brother, Mycroft. (looking up) What time do you make it, Watson?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Either your watch is wrong, or Mycroft has miscalculated. And knowing Mycroft, I suggest you reset your watch. Watson automatcially obeys.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I don't mind telling you I'm a bit apprehensive about this.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm rather curious myself as to what is going on in that Machiavellian mind of his.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I don't mean Mycroft, I mean Madame Valladon.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Don't worry.    She's perfectly safe with Mrs. Hudson. He opens the door and they start in. INT. LOBBY - DIOGENES CLUB - DAY Dominating the lobby is a large statue of Queen Victoria. Presiding over the reception desk is a uniformed PORTER of military bearing, with one arm and a chest full of campaign ribbons. Holmes and Watson stride in.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (to porter) To see Mr. Mycroft Holmes.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Right you are. He's expecting you in the upstairs study. Now if you gentlemen will sign in -- (opens leather-bound register, turns it toward them) Surname, Christian name, address, nature of business -- He holds out the pen to them, but they are gone. He looks around in consternation, sees them hurrying up the majestic staircase, steps out from behind his desk.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Gentlemen...! READING ROOM - DIOGENES CLUB - DAY A huge room, with more marble than a mausoleum, and just about as lively.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . A dozen elderly Establishment types are sunk deep in the leather armchairs, buried behind their copies of The Times.  Holmes and Watson are proceeding toward the study.  Suddenly Holmes stops beside one of the old fossils, who has fallen asleep in his chair, The Times in his lap, and between his fingers a lighted cigar with an ash four inches long. Holmes picks up an ashtray, holds it under the cigar -- just in time to catch the falling ash. As  he replaces the ashtray, he scrutinizes the ash.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Jamaican, no doubt -- either Tropical or Golosina -- I'm not quite sure. He and Watson continue toward the study door. INT. STUDY - DIOGENES CLUB - DAY It is a very elegant room   -- shelves of leather-bound volumes reach to the high   ceiling, there are antique terrestrial and celestial   gloves, scientific instruments in polished brass, marble   busts of English statesmen. MYCROFT HOLMES is standing at a refectory table, with his back to the door, engaged in a curious operation. A dusty bottle of wine is held in an ingeniously engineered cradle. As he turns the crank, the bottle tilts forward gently, and he decants the wine into three glasses without disturbing the sediment. Mycroft is an impressive figure of a man, seven years older than Sherlock, impeccably dressed. Behind his snobbish airs and bantering manner, one senses tremendous reserves of strength and authority. The door opens, and Holmes and Watson enter.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (without turning) Come in, come in, Sherlock -- Dr. Watson... Sit down. (Holmes and Watson seat themselves) You're looking very fit, both of you.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Thank you.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (putting down hat and cane) And how are you, Mycroft? How's your gout?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Under control. Except for the occasional twinge. He brings over two of the glasses of wine to Holmes and Watson.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I have a treat for you -- a very old Madeira -- 1814. There are  only six bottles left in the world.  I have two of them, and am negotiating for a third.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: If you don't mind my saying so, anybody who's susceptible to gout shouldn't be -- Mycroft has moved back to the table and picked up his glass of Madeira.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The last doctor who warned me about that was crossing Piccadilly, slipped on an orange peel, and was run over by a delivery van from the Fortnum and Mason. Your very good health. He and Watson sip their drinks, but not Holmes.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Why are you wasting this precious stuff on us?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Well, I see you so rarely. How long has it been? Not since the case of the Greek interpreter. (to Watson) Isn't it ridiculous? Two brothers living in the same town...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: In the same town, perhaps -- but not the same world.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: : EXT. DIOGENES CLUB - DAY Holmes, cane in hand, and Watson are swiftly ascending the steps of a building with an imposing Palladian facade. Beside the entrance is a discreet sign reading: DIOGENES CLUB. Members Only. As they reach the top of the steps, Watson stops Holmes.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: (taking another sip) Mmmm.    Superb. How old did you say it was?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: .    One year before Waterloo.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: One year before Waterloo?    Think of that.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You do know where Waterloo is, don't you, Doctor?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Belgium, isn't it?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Quite. (turning to Holmes) And speaking of Belgium, it has come to my attention that you are interested in the whereabouts of a certain engineer.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yes, I am.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Well, I can save you a lot of trouble.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'd be grateful for any suggestion -- MYCROFT My suggestion is that you pursue it no further.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Any particular reason?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Because it involves the national security. We are handling this matter ourselves.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We?   Who's we?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The Diogenes Club, of course.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I didn't say that.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I have always suspected that there was some underground connection between this stodgy and seemingly calcified establishment and the Foreign Office in Whitehall.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That's neither here nor there.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It seems to me that The Diogenes Club is here, there and everywhere. When there are rumblings of revolt in the Sudan, an expedition subsidized by your club conveniently shows up to study the source of the Nile. When there is trouble along the Indian frontier, some of your fellow members pop up in the Himalayas, alledgedly looking for the Abominable Snowman. A YOUNG MAN in morning coat and striped trousers comes in, holding a telegram. Mycroft crosses to him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (to Watson) What a fertile imagination my brother has. At the age of five, by carefully observing a neighbor's house, he deduced that babies were brought not by the stork, but by the mid-wife in her satchel.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: As good an explanation as any. Mycroft has taken the telegram, and is coming forward with it. The young man clears his throat.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yes, Wiggins?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: An immediate answer is requested, sir. Mycroft inserts a monocle in his eye, opens the telegram, moves toward the desk reading it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Tell them that the three boxes go to Glennahurich, and the red runner goes to the castle.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The three boxes to Glennahurich, the red runner to the castle. Very good, sir. He exits. Holmes glances toward the telegram as Mycroft puts it down on his desk. Catching his look, Mycroft turns his telegram face-down, lets the monocle drop from his eye.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Why don't you crumple it up and swallow it -- to make sure.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: My dear Sherlock, there  are certain affairs that do not come  within the province of the private  detective. They have to be dealt with on  an altogether different level.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: In other words, you want me to stay within my limits.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I do indeed.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Speaking of limits, what exactly is Jonah Limited?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Sherlock, when I said drop this case, it was not merely a suggestion -- it was an order!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: By whose authority?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: By the authority of Her Majesty's government. I hope I've made myself clear.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Perfectly. In his nervousness he drops his bowler, which rolls along the floor.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Now if you'll excuse me, gentlemen -- WATSON Goodbye, sir.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: A pleasure, as always. He and Watson retrieve their hats, move toward the door.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (to Holmes) Just a minute. (picks up Holmes' cane) You forgot your tool-kit. He tosses the cane to Holmes, who catches it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You will be gentle, won't you, when you tell her you're dropping the case?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Watson, what does the word Glennahurich suggest to you?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Absolutely nothing.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's Scottish.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Is it?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: And like all Scottish names, it's really a word picture. Glen means valley, na means of the, and Hurich, if memory serves me, means yew tree.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You're just trying to impress me.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: So the three boxes go to the Valley of the Yew Tree. He resumes whistling. They start to cross the street, skirting a parked hansom. Feeding the horse is the same cabbie who fished Gabrielle out of the river, and in the passenger seat is Von Tirpitz, the craggy-faced Prussian we saw before. He stares fixedly after Holmes and Watson. Holmes and Watson come up to the door of 221B, and Watson fishes his key out. Holmes is still whistling.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (singing along) And I'll be in Scotland before ye... (breaks off, looks at Holmes apprehensively) You are dropping the case, aren't you, Holmes?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Open the door. Watson turns the key in the lock, starts to open the door, but is stopped by a chain on the inside. Through the opening a revolver appears, aiming at them point- blank.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Don't shoot, Mrs. Hudson -- you're liable to lose two excellent tenants.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . INT. DOWNSTAIRS - 221B BAKER STEET - DAY Mrs. Hudson withdraws the gun, unhooks the chain. She is also holding an embroidery hoop. She opens the door, and Holmes and Watson step into the vestibule.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Oh, at last. It's been a ghastly experience.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Why?   What happened?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Did you ever try doing embroidery with a gun in your hand?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (taking gun from her) You'll be relieved to know it was not loaded. He starts up the stairs, followed by Watson.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Holmes, you didn't answer my  question. Are you planning to disobey  Mycroft's orders? He's not just your   brother, you know. You'd be defying Her   Majesty's government... No reaction from Holmes. As they reach the landing, Gabrielle is waiting for them in the open doorway of their flat.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Any news?   Did you find out anything? INT. LIVING ROOM - 221B BAKER STREET - DAY Holmes and Watson step inside.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Let's just say I know what the next step will be.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (anxious) Yes?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I want you to pack your things.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Where are we going?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Holmes, let me caution you --- Holmes has put the gun down, and is crossing to one of the book-shelves.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (to Gabrielle) At 7:30 this evening, Dr. Watson and I are going to take you to Victoria Station, and put you on the boat-train.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The boat-train?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Well, that's better. Holmes has taken a railway guide from the shelf and is consulting it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You're sending me back to Brussels?   Is that it?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Madame Valladon, you must understand...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (to Holmes, agitated) I came here to find my husband -- you were going to help me -- WATSON Yes, my dear. But circumstances have changed -- GABRIELLE The great detective! Well, maybe this case is too small for you -- 79.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: On the contrary. It's being handled at a much higher level -- GABRIELLE Well, I won't go back to Brussels. Maybe you're giving up, but I'm not. (tears welling up in her eyes) I'm going to go on looking for him. And nobody's going to stop me -- even if they try to kill me.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (looking up from railway guide) Are you quite finished? If you recall, what I said was that we're going to put you on the boat-train -- I didn't say you were going to stay on it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She's not?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: At 7:30, Mr. Holmes and Dr. Watson will be seen waving goodbye to Madame Valladon at Victoria Station. At eight-twelve, Mr. and Mrs. Ashdown accompanied by their valet John -- (a glance at Watson)
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: : EXT. BAKER STREET - DAY Holmes and Watson are walking toward 221B.   Holmes is whistling 'Loch Lomond.'
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: will appear at Euston Station, and board the Highland Express to Inverness.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Mr. and Mrs.... ?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (moving toward Holmes) Thank you. I'm sorry for what I said. (kisses him on cheek)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That's not necessary.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (smiling through tears) I'll go and pack. She hurries off toward Watson's room.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (acidly) Maybe I should do it, since I'm the valet. Holmes replaces the railway guide on the shelf.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Holmes, what exactly are you up to?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: As you like to put it in your chronicles, the game is afoot.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: But what game? Are you really that interested in the Belgian engineer? Without answering, Holmes heads for his bedroom.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Or the wife of the Belgian engineer? Holmes, by this time in his bedroom, shuts the door. Gabrielle reappears from the other bedroom, carrying a glove.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You don't like me very much, do you? She moves toward the couch.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Nothing of the sort. Quite the opposite... But there's more to this case than meets the eye -- By this time Gabrielle has picked up her parasol from the couch, and is obviously searching about.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Looking for something?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: My other glove.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Let me help you.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . He peers under the couch. Gabrielle moves toward the window, shakes the parasol, opens it a few times.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Here it is. He comes up from under the couch with the missing glove.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Thank you. She slowly starts to shut the parasol. EXT. BAKER STREET - DAY Through the upstairs window of 221B we see Gabrielle shutting the parasol. CAMERA PULLS BACK TO INCLUDE the hansom parked across the street, and von Tirpitz watching. He signals to the cabbie, who is back on his perch. The cabbie flicks his whip, and the hansom takes off down the street.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: All right.    You can look now. Gabrielle's head appears from under the covers of the lower berth.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Am I embarrassing you, Mr. Holmes?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Not at all. Would it surprise you if I told you I once spent the night with 121 women?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Oh?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: On a very interesting case -- in a harem in Constantinople. He starts to climb up the ladder to the upper berth. INT. THIRD CLASS CARRIAGE - NIGHT There is the normal complement of passengers, men, women and children, of the middle and lower classes. The only unusual occupants are a group of seven MONKS, in brown habits and cowls. Watson, in valet's livery, comes down the aisle, proceeds toward a window-seat where he has left his umbrella and bowler. The resf of the bench is occupied by monks, as is the facing bench. As Watson tries to squeeze between them, he steps on the foot of one of the monks.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Sorry, father -- I mean, friar -- or is it abbot? There is no answer from the monk. Watson picks up his bowler, settles himself in his seat, starts to fan himself with his hat. He turns sociably to the monk beside him, who is absorbed in his Bible.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Going to Scotland, you gentlemen?   So are we... As he fans himself the ear-pieces of his stethoscope, which is coiled inside the crown of his bowler, dangle down. He quickly shoves them back inside.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm a valet. My master and mistress and I are our way to Inverness. Ever been there? Beautiful country.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . The monk looks up from his Bible, points to his lips, shakes his head.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Oh, forgive me. You must be one of those orders that's taken the vow of silence. Trappists, I believe you're called. The monk doesn't answer. Watson turns away, looks out the window -- but there's nothing to be seen. Then he folds, bored. He glances casually at the Bible in the monk's hands. The Good Book is opened to a page headed: JONAH.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I see you're reading the book of Jonah. Funny - we were just talking about Johan this morning... (realizes the hopelessness of the conversation, breaks off) Never mind. He pulls down the shade, closes his eyes, tries to compose himself into sleep. INT. SLEEPING COMPARTMENT - NIGHT Holmes is stretched out in the upper berth, which is in darkness. In the lower, Gabrielle is propped up against a pillow, reading a magazine by the light of a gas lamp. Other magazines are scattered across her blanket.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Women are never to be trusted entirely -- not the best of them. Holmes raises himself on his elbow, glances down over the edge of his berth.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What did you say?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I didn't say it -- you did. According to Dr. Watson.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: : EXT. COUNTRYSIDE - NIGHT The Highland Express is speeding northward through the moonlit landscape, its steam whistle hooting mournfully. INT. SLEEPING COMPARTMENT - NIGHT The upper and lower berths have been made up in the small, gaslit compartment. Gabrielle's dress is on a hanger, but there is no sign of her at the moment. Holmes is just pulling a night-shirt over his head.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Oh.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He gave me some back issues of Strand Magazine.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The good doctor is constantly putting words into my mouth.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Then you deny it?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Not at all. I am not a whole-hearted admirer of womankind.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm not very fond of them myself.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The most affectionate woman I ever knew was a murderess.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Oh?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It was one of those passionate affairs -- at odd hours -- right in my laboratory. And all the time, behind my back, she was stealing cyanide to sprinkle on her husband's steak and kidney pie.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You mustn't judge all women by -- HOLMES Of course not. Only the ones I was involved with. And I don't just mean professionally -- kleptomaniacs, nymphomaniacs, pyromaniacs. Take my fiancee, for instance -- GABRIELLE Your fiancee?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She was the daughter of my violin teacher
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: we were engaged to be married -- the invitations were out, I was being fitted for a tail-coat -- and twenty-four hours before the wedding, she died of influenza.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm sorry.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It just proves my contention that women are unreliable and not to be trusted. (a beat) Good night, Mrs. Ashdown. He pulls the curtain across his berth.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Good night, Mr. Ashdown. She closes her curtain, as the train whistle sounds. INT. THIRD CLASS CARRIAGE - NIGHT Most of the passengers in the car have fallen asleep, in various uncomfortable positions, including Watson. The monk beside Watson looks at him, to make sure he's out, then rises and moves toward a monk seated apart from the others.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (in a whisper) Die Spur fuehrt nach Inverness. Die steigen dort aus. Dort muessen wir ihn finded -- den Valladon! The other monk looks up.   Under the cowl we recognize the face of von Tirpitz.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . EXT. INVERNESS STATION - DAY The Highland Express is pulling out of the station. As the last car disappears, and the steam clears from the tracks, we see Holmes, Gabrielle and Watson on the platform. A BAGGAGEMAN is loading their luggage on a hand-cart, under Watson's supervision.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Let's see -- two, three, four -- Gabrielle removes her parasol, which has been inserted under the straps of her suitcase.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'll take that.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (to baggageman) How do you get to Glennahurich?    How far is it?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Glennahurich?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You know -- a valley -- with a yew tree... ? Gabrielle casually opens her parasol.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's about a mile out of town. (a beat) Why would you be wanting to go there?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Well, if it's got a view, it might be a nice place for a picnic.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's got a view, right enough -- but it's no place for a picnic.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Why not?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Because it's a cemetary.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . Gabrielle looks at Holmes. CAMERA PANS UP TOWARD an iron footbridge, spanning the railway tracks. Moving across it in single file are the seven cowled Trappist monks, with von Tirpitz in the lead.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (a note of excitement) The three boxes. Is that it, Holmes?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I would think so.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The two small ones -- they must be children's coffins. Holmes starts to cut across between the graves, Gabrielle and Watson following. At the grave-site, the workmen are removing the coffins from the cart. There is one large grave, two smaller ones. A couple of grave-diggers stand by respectfully, caps in hands. Holmes, Gabrielle and Watson come up behind a nearby headstone, stop and watch. At the grave-site, the minister is finishing the service.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ... earth to earth, ashes to ashes, dust to dust.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . In sure and certain hope of the resurrection to eternal life through our Lord, Jesus Christ. Amen. The workmen trundle the cart off, the minister following. The grave-diggers don their caps, pick up their shovels. From their vantage point, Holmes, Gabrielle and Watson are watching.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's so sad.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Sad -- and rather odd. There are no flowers -- and no mourners. The grave-diggers have finished filling in the graves when Holmes, Gabrielle and Watson come up.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Morning.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (looking up) Morning.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Working you hard, Dad?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Not really. This is healthy country. Sometimes you sit around for weeks with nothing to do. Then you get three in one day.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What happened?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: An accident. Aye. Father and two sons, they say -- they were found floating in the loch.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Local people?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No. Nobody around here knows them. The story is that their boat capsized in a swell -- but I don't believe it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What do you believe?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You may think I'm an old fool or an old drunk -- but I've living around Loch Ness all my life...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Are you trying to tell us it was the monster?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Damn right. MacLarnin saw the kids' faces when they were pulled out of the water -- looked like old men -- must've died of fright.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Incredible.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Is it? Last Easter Sunday my wife and me, we were on our way to services, when suddenly... But what's the use? He picks up a white-washed wooden cross, plants it at the head of the grave. The other grave-digger has inserted smaller crosses into the other two mounds of earth.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (taking some coins out of his pocket) Here you are, Dad. (hands them to the grave- digger)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Thank you... You look like nice people. If you're wanting a holiday in Scotland, go to Loch Lomond, go to Holy Loch -- but stay away from Loch Ness. He and his partner shoulder their shovels, move off.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (snorting) To think that people still believe in that nonsense. Here we are, living in the Nineteenth Century -- 90.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm ashamed to admit it -- but I was relieved when he mentioned a father and two boys. It could possibly have anything to do with Emile.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It would appear not.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: However, there still remains the clue of the castle and the red runner -- wherever it may be. They are about to get under way when suddenly Holmes stops them. Coming down the avenue toward them are four small boys, in knickerbockers and caps, carrying bouquets of flowers. Without a word, Holmes draws Gabrielle and Watson back to their hiding place, behind the headstone. The four boys approach the freshly-filled graves. They remove their caps, lay their flowers on each of the two small graves, then kneel down and bow their heads in prayer. From their position behind the headstone, Holmes, Watson and Gabrielle are watching the four boys, who have their backs to them.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: If they're unidentified graves, why are those boys bringing flowers?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Because it's their brothers who have just been buried.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Their brothers?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: And they're not boys. They're as tall as they'll ever grow. Hand me some pebbles, will you?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Pebbles.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . He picks some up from the ground, hands them to Holmes, who tosses them in the direction of the graves. The pebbles strike a granite cross. At the sound, the four boys simultaneously turn their heads over their shoulders. Despite their slight bodies they have the features of mature men. Gabrielle and Watson react to the sight.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: They are -- how do you say it in English?
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: : EXT. GLENNAHURICH CEMETARY - DAY Under a leaden sky, the yew trees which give the place its name brood over ancient gravestones. Holmes, Gabrielle and Watson come down an overgrown path, stop and look off. A rather meagre funeral procession is moving along the avenue which runs between the rows of graves. It consists of one normal-size pine coffin and two smaller ones, loaded on a cart which is being wheeled by a couple of workmen. Bringing up behind is a MINISTER, with an open prayer book in his hands.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: nains.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Midgets.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (nodding) Boys with the faces of old men...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I still don't see -- HOLMES Would it help if I told you they were acrobats?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Not at all.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Do you remember a tumbling act -- six brothers -- missing from the circus?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Oh, yes -- that case you turned down -- I completely forgot.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Some of us are cursed with memories like flypaper. And stuck there is a staggering of miscellaneous date, mostly useless. The four midgets have now risen, and putting on their caps, move off down the avenue. Holmes, Gabrielle and Watson emerge from their place of concealment.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (worriedly) Mr. Holmes, is those are not children, then -- ?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Quite. The question now is -- who's in the third grave?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : EXT. GLENNAHURICH CEMETARY - NIGHT The point of a crowbar digs under the edge of a coffin lid, which starts to give with a squealing protest of nails. CAMERA PULLS BACK TO REVEAL Holmes, standing in the large grave, from which the earth has been removed. Kneeling beside the grave, watching anxiously, are Gabrielle and Watson, the latter holding a bullseye lantern. Holmes pries the lid open, disclosing the corpse of a middle-aged man. His arms are folded across his chest, and on the third finger of his left hand is a wedding ring similar to Gabrielle's. From the picture of him we have seen earlier, we recognize the face as that of Emile Valladon. Gabrielle lets out a piercing scream, collapses in a faint. Watson catches her.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Holmes!   She's fainted.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (preoccupied) Hand me that lantern. Watson passes down the lantern, and Holmes slowly shines the beam along the length of the coffin.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It is Valladon, isn't it?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Obviously. What is not so obvious is why his wedding ring has turned green -- 93. The lantern beam now reveals that laid out at Valladon's feet are three canaries -- their plumage bleached a grey- white color.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: and why there are three dead canaries in the coffin. White canaries.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You have a lovely view of the loch from here -- as soon as the morning mist rolls away. (crosses to desk, picks up guide book) If you've a mind to do any sight-seeing, here's a guide to the local points of interest.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Thank you. The manager starts toward the door, nodding to Watson.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: This way, please. I will show you to your room. Watson picks up his suitcase, follows him. INT. HOTEL CORRIDOR - DAY The manager and Watson come out, the latter shutting the door.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I suppose you're putting me in the basement.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No, your room is in the attic.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Good.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's the privy that's in the basement. Watson grunts as the manager leads him up a narrow flight of stairs. INT. HOTEL ROOM - DAY Holmes removes his coat, turns to Gabrielle.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: May I have your wedding ring, please?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . Gabrielle tearfully removes her ring, hands it to Holmes. From his vest pocket he now produces Valladon's ring -- the copper has a greenish tinge to it. He crosses to the window, compares the two rings in the light. Gabrielle sinks down on the edge of one of the beds.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Just as I thought. There is a distinct difference in color between your ring and your husband's. (a sob from Gabrielle) Which leads me to believe that the cause of death was not drowning... (Gabrielle is now crying) I wish you would stop that. (crossing to her) Stop it!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm sorry.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I know it's not easy. But you must remember that we're that nice couple from London, on Holiday in the Highlands.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (a final sniffle) I'll try.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That's much better.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Thank you. She manages a tentative smile.   Holmes looks at her for a long moment, then -- HOLMES (gruffly) Now, if I may proceed without further interruptions -- WATSON'S VOICE (from off) Mr. Ashdown!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . INT. HOTEL CORRIDOR - DAY Watson comes dashing down the narrow stairs from the attic, races toward teh door of Holmes' room.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Mr. Ashdown! He flings the door open. INT. HOTEL ROOM - DAY Watson bursts in breathlessly.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Holmes! I saw it! I saw it from the attic! It's out there in the lake!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You saw what?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (looking around desperately) The telescope. Where's the telescope?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What did you see?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The monster!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The monster? Watson fishes a small telescope out of Holmes' suitcase, rushes through the open French window to the balcony. EXT. BALCONY - DAY Watson focuses the telescope on the lake. LOCH NESS THROUGH TELESCOPE - DAY Through the swirling mist which clings to the surface of the lake, a shadowy figure with a long, monster-like neck can be see gliding along.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . EXT. BALCONY - DAY Watson almost drops the telescope in excitement.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: There it is!    There it is! Holmes joins him on the balcony.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Look for yourself. He hands the telescope to Holmes. Gabrielle comes up to the window behind them. Holmes trains the telescope on the lake.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: See it?    See it? LOCH NESS - THROUGH TELESCOPE - DAY Holmes' eye slowly scans the lake, but there is no sign of Watson's monster -- just the rolling mist. EXT. BALCONY - DAY Holmes lowers the telescope.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I see nothing.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Nothing? He grabs the telescope from Holmes, looks toward the lake.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's gone.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Gone?   Maybe it was never there.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I swear to you -- I saw it -- clear as anything -- 98.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Watson, as you so succinctly put it, we are living in the Nineteenth Century -- He steps back into the room. INT. HOTEL ROOM - DAY Watson comes halfway through the French window.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Maybe that grave-digger was right -- the swell, and the boat overturning -- HOLMES Monsieur Valladon may have been found in the lake -- but he did not drown. He died of asphyxiation.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Asphyxiation.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (holding up wedding rings) There is only one substance that can turn a copper ring green and bleach the color out of canaries -- chlorine gas.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That may be. But the fact remains that I saw something out there.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: A figment of your imagination. Now let us be logical. The only concrete lead we have is the reference to the castle -- (picks up guide book from desk, opens it to map) The question is, which castle?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You call yourself logical?   You're the least logical man I know.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Am I?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: How can you say it's a figment of my imagination, when for years you've been saying I have no imagination whatsoever! He looks at Holmes almost triumphantly.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : SERIES OF SHOTS - DAY Holmes, Gabrielle, and Watson bicycling away from the hotel. Holmes, in knickerbockers and a Norfolk jacket, and Gabrielle, holding her parasol, are on a tandem. Watson is behind them, on a bicycle with a picnic basket attached to the rack. He is in his valet's outfit, with metal clips around his trouser cuffs. The three of them bicycling past a long stone wall. They pedal up to an imposing castle.   Holmes dismounts, knocks on the front door. Our trio bicycling through a copse of trees. They approach another castle. On a steep road, they ride through a flock of sheep. They are proceeding along a causeway, away from a third castle. CUT TO: EXT. LAKE SHORE - DAY Holmes and Gabrielle are sitting on a blanket, the contents of the picnic basket spread before them, having lunch. Watson is pouring the wine. Their bicycles are resting nearby.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We have so far investigated  eight drafty castles -- had our bicycles  attacked by sheep and our ears assaulted  by bagpipes
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: : EXT. CALEDONIAN HOTEL - DAWN An open carriage is proceeding along the driveway toward the hotel, scatting a flock of sheep grazing nearby. Watson is sitting beside the coachman. Holmes and Gabrielle are in the passenger seat, their luggage is strapped to the back. Through the trees which line the road we glimpse Loch Ness, which is partly obscured by a low-lying mist. The carriage pulls up in front of the hotel, which is identified by a sign above the entrance, and Holmes, Watson and Gabrielle get out. CLOSE SHOT - HOTEL REGISTER Holmes' hand is writing: Mr. And Mrs. Ashdown and valet, London. INT. HOTEL ROOM - DAWN The MANAGER, in kilts, is just opening the curtains -- disclosing a view of the mist-shrouded lake through the window. The room is on the second floor, and is furnished in a style which has been described as Scotch Baronial -- twin beds with a night-table between them, wardrobe, chiffonier, desk, a couple of chairs, and several mounted stags' heads. Holmes and Gabrielle are in the room, Watson is bringing their bags through the door.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: and we are exactly where  we started.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (to Gabrielle) Would you like some cranberry sauce, dear?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yes, dear.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Would you pass the cranberry sauce, please, John?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yes, dear. As he does so, he catches sight of something o.s.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (calling) I say there. Good afternoon.     Remember me? On the road above, approaching a bridge which spans the lake where it narrows into a stream, are the seven Trappist monks, walking slowly in single file. Watson waves to them, but the monks pay no attention to him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (to Holmes) Some chaps I met on the train. We had a long conversation -- or rather, I had a long conversation -- because they're not allowed to talk -- Trappists, you know. Just study their Bibles. You'll never guess what the one next to me was reading
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: the Book of Jonah -- isn't that odd?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (looking after the monks) Quite. As he turns back, he notices that Gabrielle is manipulating her parasol in the air.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What is it, dear? What's the matter?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: A bee. She continues to work the parasol, alternately opening it and partially closing it. On the bridge von Tirpitz, who is at the rear of the file of monks, glances back toward the lakeshore.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Well, I don't think we have to bother with this castle. It's just a pile of rubble.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Then why are they taking precautions? She points to the sign -- and to a guard coming up the driveway, with a couple of huge mastiffs on leashes.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Why, indeed? (turning the tandem around) Let's go.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Go where?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: When rebuffed at the front door, one's only choice is to try the tradesmen's entrance.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . They move off.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Sorry.   No visitors allowed.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Are you the guide here?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yes. The castle is closed to the public while work is going on.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What are they doing?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's being restored by the Society for the Preservation of Scottish Monuments.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Too bad. I particularly wanted my wife to see Urquhart Castle. The tower is one of the most interesting examples of -- about 1400, wasn't it?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That's right.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Let me see -- was it built under James the Second or James the Third?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The Thrid... If you come back next year, we'll be all done here, and I'll be glad to show you around.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Thank you.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . As the three of them move off, a canvas-topped wagon comes through the stone archway, stops at the front of the steps leading to the inner courtyard.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Pleasant sort, isn't he?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Pleasant, but ignorant. He was off one hundred years and one James. (taps guide-book in his pocket) It's actually 1500 and James the Fourth.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: If he's an official guide, shouldn't he know... ?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: If he's an official guide. They have now reached the wall against which they left their bicycles. Suddenly Holmes stops, attracted by the sound of birds chirping.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Listen...   Do you hear anything, Watson?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (concentrating) No. Those birds are making too much of a racket.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (looking off) They're not just birds -- they're our old friends. Watson and Gabrielle follow his gaze. From the back of the wagon, the carriers have removed the small bird-cage we saw in the mail-drop on Ashdown Street. They hand it to a workman, who starts up the steps with it. To another couple of workmen they pass down an open-sided crate in which rest two heavy glass bottles protected by wicker. Stencilled on the wooden slate of the crate are the words: SULPHURIC ACID - CORROSIVE.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . Holmes is watching thoughtfully, Gabrielle and Watson are puzzled.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Sulphuric acid?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The more we find out the less sense it makes.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: To a graduate chemist it makes a great deal of sense. Sulphuric acid, when exposed to salt-water, produces chlorine gas. (a beat) Would you mind clasping your hands, Watson?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Like this?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: A little lower... Thank you. Watson has lowered his clasped hands, and Holmes uses them as a foothold to go scrambling up the scaffolding of the nearby wall. Reaching the top, he looks off in the direction of the tower. The workman carrying the canary cage, and the two carrying the crate of sulphuric acid are approaching the tower. A draw-bridge comes down, and the three men cross the moat and enter the tower.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That tower may be more interesting than I thought -- and not just architecturally. Out of the ruined gatehouse comes the guard with the two mastiffs on leashes. The dogs start to snarl viciously.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Holmes, I have a feeling we're redundant here.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . Holmes leaps down from the scaffolding, wheels the tandem around, starts back in the direction from which they came. Gabrielle follows. Watson hurries after them with his bicycle, casting anxious glances over his shoulder as the dogs continue barking.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We have now observed the castle from the front, from the back, from the side, from land, from water... what now?  Are you planning to spend the night out here?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: If necessary.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You're going to catch your death of cold. (to Gabrielle) Wouldn't it be ironic if Holmes' last case were a case of pneumonia? (with an embarrassed chuckle) Sorry. Gabrielle glances past them, and her eyes widen.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (pointing off) What's that? Holmes and Watson turn their heads.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . About half a mile away, moving in and out of patches of drifting mist, is Watson's monster, its long reptillian neck cutting through the water. Watson leaps to his feet.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Holmes! Holmes grabs his arm, pulls him back into his seat.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Quick, Watson. After it! He grabs his oar, and Watson belatedly joins in. They strain at the oars, setting a course which will intercept the monster.  Gabrielle leans forward in her seat, trying to peer past them through the curtains of mist. The monster is much closer now -- no more than a quarter of a mile away. Suddenly Watson stops rowing.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Holmes, what are we doing?   We should be going away from it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Keep rowing, dammit! Watson resumes pulling on his oar.   As they row, Holmes looks over his shoulder. The monster has started to submerge. Its head disappears beneath the surface of the water, and the wake it leaves behind soon trails off into the mist. Holmes ships his oar.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We've lost it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (stops rowing) At least you admit there's an it, not just a figment of my imagination.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Quiet.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . He listens intently. There is only the sound of water slapping against the side of the boat. The mist is heavier now, and billowing around them.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (to Watson) Do you have your stethoscope with you?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Never without it. He removes his bowler, unwinds the stethoscope from the inside the crown, hands it to Holmes. Holmes plugs in the ear-pieces, leans over the side of the boat, extends the other end of the stethoscope to the surface of the water.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What is it?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I can hear something... We become aware of the faint beating of engines, accompanied by a bubbling sound.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's getting closer -- closer -- Suddenly the surface of the water breaks, about twenty yards away from them, and the head and neck of the monster rear up from the depths. Watson is first to notice it and jumps to his feet, making choking noises. Gabrielle sees it and screams. Watson grabs an oar, throws it at the monster as it comes past. The backwash hits the boat broadside, rocking it, and Holmes, Watson and Gabrielle are spilled into the lake. The monster moves away from them, heading in the general direction of the castle. It disappears into the mist. Holmes is the first to come up, looks around, sees Gabrielle surfacing a few yards away, swims to her.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Are you all right?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I lost my parasol.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Where's Watson? He glances around, sees Watson's bowler floating nearby, swims over to it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Watson? He lifts the hat -- but Watson isn't under it. As Gabrielle hoists herself into the boat, Watson clambers over the other side. After a moment Holmes joins them, and they sit there, sopping wet and breathing heavily.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I have come face to   face with man-eating tigers -- I was once   caught in a stampede of wild elephants --   India, you know -- but I wasn't half as   frightened. This beast seems to have   a personal grudge against us.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I just hope it doesn't come back.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I don't think it will. (pointing off) Look! They glance in the indicated direction. There is no sign of the monster. But the mist has momentarily lifted to reveal the castle, and an odd sight greets their eyes -- the wooden scaffolding in front of the tower is slowly rising into the air.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (amazed) What strange goings-on.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Not really. My guess is that the monster, after a hard day's work, has returned home for his supper.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . The scaffolding in front of the tower slowly descends back into the place, as mist once more engulfs the castle.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yes, I know. But would you believe that you can't borrow a decent pair of trousers in this place? Holmes resumes pacing, and Watson becomes aware of his whistling.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Would you like to confide in us? No answer from Holmes.    Watson turns to Gabrielle.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Whenever he starts whistling, I know he's getting close to a solution.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's nothing new, actually. We've come across this situation before.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We have?   Where?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: At the ballet.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Ballet?
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: : EXT. URQUHART CASTLE - DAY On a promontory jutting into Loch Ness stand the remains of a medieval fortress. Around the Tower, the Motte, and the ruins of the East wall, wooden scaffolding has been erected, and a couple of dozen men are engaged in what appears to be repair work. Amidst the rubble of the Nether Bailey, an encampment of tents has been set up. Holmes, Gabrielle and Watson come bicycling up along a fence on the heights overlooking the castle, dismount in front of the locked gates. Attached to the gatepost is a sign reading: WARNING: No Unauthorized Person Permitted Beyond This Point.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: : EXT. URQUHART CASTLE - DAY Holmes, Gabrielle and Watson are coming up a path from the lakeside, leading their bicycles. They lean the cycles against a ruined wall, start across the courtyard. A middle-aged MAN in kilts emerges from the tumbled-down gatehouse, comes toward them.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: : EXT. LOCH NESS - EARLY EVENING The sun has just gone down behind the hills, but there is still light in the sky. An ominous mist is beginning to settle on the water. Gabrielle is sitting in the stern of a rowboat, her parasol in her lap. She is wearing Holmes' Norfolk jacket over her dress to ward off the chill. On the rowing seat, facing her, are Watson and Holmes, the latter in his waistcoat. Their oars are pulled in, and they are watching Urquhart Castle, on the opposite side of the lake.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: : INT. HOTEL ROOM - NIGHT Holmes, in a different suit   of clothes, is pacing across the room, whistling the main   theme from "Swan Lake." He stops before the open French   window, gazes out toward the lake. Gabrielle is propped    up in bed, a blanket drawn up to her chin, watching him.    Watson, who has changed into a pair of kilts, is standing   in front of the fireplace, warming his backside. Gabrielle glances at Watson, suppresses a giggle.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: There's a lake -- and there's a castle -- and there's a swan that isn't really a swan -- or, in this case, a monster that isn't really a monster -- WATSON Then what is it?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What is it indeed that feeds on canary birds and sulphuric acid, and has an engine for a heart?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: An engine?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The stethoscope is a very sensitive instrument, and water is an excellent conductor of sound. There is no doubt that what we are dealing with is a mechanical monster.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Oh?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Not only is it equipped with an artificial heart, it also has artificial lungs. Judging from the bubbles on the surface of the lake, it uses some form of air pump.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You think my husband was involved in all this?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yes, Madame Valladon.    I'm sure of it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: But why would anybody build a mechanical monster? Just to scare people?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Not very likely.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Why did they try to keep me from finding my husband? And why was he buried anonymously?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I think I have a pretty good notion of what they're up to -- the Society for the Preservation of Scottish Monuments -- better known as the Diogenes Club.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The Diogenes Club? There is a knock on the door.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Come in. The door opens and the hotel manager enters, holding a magnum of champagne.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Mr. Ashdown, I have a bottle of champagne for you.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (crossing to him) A bottle of champagne? I didn't order it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No, indeed. You are to deliver it. These are my instructions. He hands the magnum to Holmes.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Instructions from whom?   Deliver it where?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I wouldn't know, sir. But there's a carriage waiting for you downstairs.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Are you sure you have the right Mr. Ashdown?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (flatly) Quite sure, Mr. Holmes. He turns and exits.   Holmes taps the bottle of champagne thoughtfully.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Well, Watson, I would say the curtain is going up on the last act.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I don't like the sound of it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Please be careful. As Holmes starts toward the door, Watson reaches into his sporran.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You'd better take this with you. He produces a revolver, holds it out to Holmes.    Holmes ignores it, exits. EXT. CALEDONIAN HOTEL - NIGHT A gig is waiting in front of the entrance, and leaning against it is the guide we saw earlier at Urquhart. Holmes comes out, carrying the champagne bottle.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Who's minding the castle?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You'd better get on.     It's late. Holmes climbs into the gig, and the guide moutns the seat beside him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Where are we going?    Some sort of party?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You won't be disappointed in the guest list.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Who's the host?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Jonah. He flicks the reins. The horse starts off at a trot, and the gig turns into the driveway. EXT. MOVING GIG - NIGHT As they drive along, Holmes glances at the guide, who is grim and uncommunicative.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Mr. Ashdown, I presume.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (turning) The red runner, I presume.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . (indicates carpet) You shouldn't have gone to all this trouble just for me.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's not for you. (calling into tent) McKeller. (to Holmes) May I have the champagne, please?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (handing him bottle)
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: : EXT. ROAD LEADING TO CASTLE - NIGHT The gig, with its two passengers, proceeds along the lakeshore, approaching the entrance to Urquhart. EXT. URQUHART CASTLE - NIGHT A workman is lighting a couple of torches attached to the ruined gatehouse when the gig comes through the archway. The guide reins up the horse in front of the steps leading to the inner courtyard -- which are now covered with a narrow red carpet. The guide nods to Holmes, who dismounts, starts up the steps, examining the red carpet. As he reaches the top, he looks off. The strip of red carpet runs across the courtyard, lit by torches planted in the ground. A couple of workmen are are unrolling the rest of the carpet toward the entrance of the tower. As Holmes passes one of the tents, the flap opens and Mycroft steps out, dressed in his inevitable frock coat.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: not a very good vintage, is it?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Mediocre.   But then again, it's not for drinking. A black-suited MAN emerges from the ten, and Mycroft gives him the champagne.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Tie it up, will you? The man moves off toward the tower.   Mycroft pulls back the flap of the tent.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: In here. Holmes passes inside, Mycroft following. INT. TENT - NIGHT It is lit by a kerosene lamp suspended from the ridge- pole. There are several cots, one of them with the bedding rolled up. Resting on the stripped cot is a trunk with the name E. VALLADON painted on it. Lying on a table, among a group of engineering models, are Gabrielle's parasol and Watson's stethoscope. There are also a couple of drafting tables, with plans and blueprints tacked to them. Holmes moves around the tent, taking all this in.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Interesting -- and educational.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Despite my most emphatic warning, you persisted in meddling. It would have served you right if you'd all drowned.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Sorry to be so unobliging. (stops beside torch) E. Valladon... H'mm.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (indicating parasol   and stethoscope) I imagine this belongs to    the pretty lady, and this belongs to    your valet... We found them floating in    the lake.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Speaking about things floating in the lake -- MYCROFT How much do you know -- or think you know?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I think you're testing some sort of underwater craft -- camouflauged to mislead the gullible. I think it's an experimental model, operated by a crew of midgets. I think it is powered by sulphuric acid batteries, and uses canaries to detect escaping gas... Altogether a strange contraption.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Not quite that unique. Right now, four countries are trying to develop what we call a submersible. But none of them could solve the critical problem -- how to stay submerged long enough to make it effective.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What does the Good Book say? "And Jonah lived in the belly of that fish for three days and three nights."
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That was our goal. And thanks to Valladon's air-pump, we got a jump on the rest of them. It's a highly complex system of filtration -- so we had a series of trials -- HOLMES And at least one error.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: During a test run in Moray Firth, pressure caused a leak in the hull. Sea water mixed with the acid in the batteries to produce chlorine gas. Before they could reach the surface, Valladon and the crew were dead.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: So you had them buried in unmarked graves, to preserve your secret.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It was essential to keep the information from your client.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You went to all those lengths to prevent Madame Valladon from fiding her husband?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Your client isn't Madame Valladon -- it's the Imperial German Government. They were after the Belgian engineer -- or rather, his invention. They knew he was employed by us, but they couldn't find out where -- so they enlisted the best brain in England to help them. You, my dear brother, have been working for the Wilhelmstrasse.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: And Madame Valladon -- what part did she play in all this?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Madame Valladon is dead.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Dead?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . Mycroft crosses to the trunk, opens the lid.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The Germans disposed of her three weeks ago, in Brussels. This is Gabrielle Valladon. He hands Holmes a small, framed photograph. Holmes looks at it with apprehension, as well he should: the picture is of a somewhat matronly woman, not the glamorous Gabrielle. Holmes lowers  the photograph. Behind it, Mycroft is glaring at him with customary arrogance.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The woman who was brought to your house in the middle of the night -- apparently fished out of the Thames -- and apparently suffering from amnesia -- is, in fact, Ilse von Hoffmanstal, one of their most skillful agents. Am I going too fast for one of the "best brains in England?"
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Go on. As Mycroft continues, Holmes picks up Ilse's water-soaked parasol and examines it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: They planted her on you quite neatly, I must admit, so that you could lead them to their objective, the air pump. Very much like using a hog to find truffles. And now perhaps you'd care to join me. I am expecting a certain royal personage from Balmoral. EXT. CASTLE - NIGHT A coach and escort approach the castle. Painted on the door of the coach are the initials "V.R." INT. CASTLE COURTYARD The entourage enters the castle courtyard and stops. Footmen open the door and bow to the lone passenger.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . Waiting on top of the steps, outside the tent, are Mycroft and Holmes. Lined up on the other side of the torch-lit red carpet are half a dozen scientists, in their best clothes. Out of the coach steps a familiar figure -- Her Majesty, QUEEN VICTORIA, Defender of the Faith, Empress of India. She is 69 years old, and dressed entirely in black. Mycroft comes down the carpeted steps to meet her.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Your Majesty. He bows. The Queen extends her hand to him, and he touches it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I trust you had a pleasant journey, Ma'am.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It was long and it was tedious. And it had better be worth our while, Mr. Holmes.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I can assure you, Ma'am, it will be. A lady-in-waiting and a uniformed equerry have now descended from the coach. Mycroft leads the party up the steps.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Now what is this curious ship we are supposed to christen?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We call it a submersible, Ma'am.    It travels under water.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Under water?    What a fantastic idea. They have now reached the top of the steps.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Ma'am, may present some of the scientists who were responsible for this achievement. J.W. Ferguson, naval architect -- FIRST SCIENTIST (bowing) Your Majesty.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Professor Simpson, our leading expert on hydraulics -- SECOND SCIENTIST (bowing) Your Majesty.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: .W. Prescott, co-inventor of the revolving periscope -- THIRD SCIENTIST (bowing) Your Majesty.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: And this is Sir Arthur Grisby, our authority on maritime ballistics -- QUEEN VICTORIA We don't claim to understand any of this. But England is proud of you, gentlemen. To think that man can now observe fish in their native habitat -- MYCROFT (trying to correct her) Well, not exactly, Ma'am -- QUEEN VICTORIA -- and underwater plants and coral reefs -- (noticing Holmes) Young man -- what was your contribution to this project?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm afraid it was rather negligible, Your Majesty.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (to the Queen) This is my brother, Sherlock, Ma'am.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Ah, yes. Sherlock Holmes. We have been following your exploits with great interest. Holmes bows, touches the Queen's extended hand.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Thank you, Ma'am.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Are you engaged in one of your fascinating cases at the moment?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: In a manner of speaking, Ma'am.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: When can we expect to read Dr. Watson's account of the case?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I hope never, Ma'am. It has not been one of my more successful endeavors. Mycroft signals to a bagpiper, who starts playing HIELAN' LADDIE.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Ah, the ceremonies are about to begin. (to Mycroft) Now where is this underwater ship of yours?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (pointing to tower) In the dungeon, Ma'am.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The dungeon? What a peculiar place to keep it. (turning to the others) Well, let us get on with it, gentlemen.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . Mycroft leads the Queen along the red runner toward the tower. Holmes follows, then the lady-in-waiting and the equerry, then the scientists. As they cross the inner courtyard, the Highland piper falls in ahead of the procession, leads them toward the drawbridge. Then he steps aside,  as the royal party crosses the drawbridge and passes through the door of the tower. INT. DUNGEON - NIGHT A high-ceilinged rock chamber, with a spiral iron staircase leading down. The floor is a concrete ramp, the lower end of it covered with water. Beyond is the entrance from the Loch, camouflaged by scaffolding and vegetation. On the upper part of the ramp is a small, primitive submarine, resting on wheels. Prominently lettered on the bow is the name H.M.S. JONAH, and suspended by a rope from the prow is the magnum of champagne which Holmes delivered. Along the sides are torpedo tubes, and fitted over the conning tower is the head and neck of the "monster" we saw in the lake. Present are half a dozen naval personnel, commanded by an officer. As the royal party comes down the spiral staircase, the officer snaps to attention. Mycroft is in the lead, followed by the Queen, Holmes, the lady-in- waiting, the equerry and the scientists.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: There she, Ma'am. Her Majesty's Ship Jonah. The four surviving midgets appear on the deck, in wool jerseys and navy caps. They start pulling on a chain which slowly raises the detachable head-and-neck of the monster toward the ceiling, disclosing the conning tower and the periscope.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: And what, may we ask, is the purpose of that hideous gargoyle?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's merely a decoy, Ma'am.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Oh. To frighten away the sharks, we imagine.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Something of the sort... The crew will now demonstrate the workings of the submersible. A SAILOR of normal height appears on the deck of the sub.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Stand to. The midgets scramble down the hatch.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Aren't they rather small for sailors?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: They are. But because of the size of the craft, the Navy made an exception.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: They should make it a rule. It's quite fatiguing to pin on all those medals while standing on our toes. There is the sound of the engines starting. Mycroft leads the Queen to an open bulkhead in the side of the sub, with Holmes and rest of the party close behind. Inside, all is noise and confusion. Metal rods are dipping into glass jars of sulphuric acid, complicated machinery is driving the propeller shaft, bellows are inflating and deflating, etc. The midgets are at their stations in the cramped quarters, pulling switches, oiling the engines, operating the periscope. Overhead is a cageful of canaries, all chirping away. Mycroft points out the various features to the Queen.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: This is the main engine, which propels it under water at the rate of two knots -- the stabilizing mechanism -- the multi- stage compressor -- the ballast tank trimmer -- the air-pump which filters and recirculates the air -- 123.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: How charming.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The air pump, Ma'am?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (pointing) The canaries. Must make the crew feel at home.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yes, Ma'am. These are the levers for firing the torpedoes, which are accurate up to as much as 120 feet -- the periscope for scanning the surface of the water -- QUEEN VICTORIA But where is the glass bottom?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The what, Ma'am?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The glass bottom.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You know -- to see the fist -- QUEEN VICTORIA -- and the plants and the corals -- MYCROFT That's not quite the idea, Ma'am. H.M.S. Jonah is being commissioned as a warship.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: A warship? (waving her hand) Stop that noise. Stop it! At a signal from Mycroft, the sub engines are turned off.
direction.name: direction
