direction.raw_text: Ma'am, if I may explain -- QUEEN VICTORIA You had better.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The Admiralty regards this craft as the ultimate weapon in naval warfare. It can seek out enemy ships and destroy them -- with these torpedoes -- while remaining completely invisible.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You mean in can fire at other vessels while under water?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yes, Ma'am.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Without any warning?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That is correct, Ma'am.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: And without showing her colors?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Indeed, Ma'am.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Mr. Holmes, we are not amused. (Mycroft stares at her) It is unsportsmanlike, it is un-English, and it is in very poor taste. We will have none of it!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I beg your pardon, Ma'am? He exchanges a look with Holmes.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Sometimes we despair of the state of the world. What will scientists think of next?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That's precisely it, Ma'am. At this very moment the Germans under Count von Zeppelin, are experimenting with a dirigible -- 125.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: A dirigible? And what, pray, is that?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: A rigid balloon, which could fly over London and drop a bomb on Buckingham Palace. It is being developed at the express orders of Kaiser Wilhelm the Second.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Nonsense. We refuse to believe that our grandson Willie would do a thing like that.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We have conclusive proof, Ma'am. Our agent in Friedrichshafen, a man named Ibbetson, actually saw the dirigible, and made a drawing of it. Unfortunately, he was apprehended before he could cross the border.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (indicating sub) Nevertheless, we don't want any part of this beastly invention. Get rid of it! Scuttle it! The sooner the better.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: May I point out, Ma'am -- QUEEN VICTORIA And don't concern yourself about that dirigible dropping bombs on us. We shall write a very sharp note to the Kaiser. (to equerry) Now we wish to return to Balmoral. She starts toward the spiral staircase. The equerry precedes her up the stairs, the lady-in-waiting follows, the scientists trail after them. Mycroft and Holmes linger behind.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Well, Mycroft, it seems we have both been undone by a woman. (Mycroft is staring at the sub) What a shame.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . All that superb engineering, and all that cunning espionage, for nought.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Not necessarily. If the Germans want that submersible so badly, why don't we give it to them?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Give it to them?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Invite them aboard for the final journey
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: seven hundred feet -- straight down.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: And how are you going to arrange that?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm rather counting on you to do it. Since you are on such intimate terms with Fraulein von Hoffmanstal. O.s., the bagpiper resumes playing.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Shall we say goodbye to Her Majesty? He starts up the spiral staircase.    Holmes follows slowly and thoughtfully.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . He crosses to Gabrielle's bed, looks down at her for a long moment, adjusts the negligee with the tip of the parasol. The he moves to the French window, opens it, glances out. LAKEFRONT - FROM HOLMES' ANGLE - DAWN The seven Trappist monks are standing on the shore, silhouetted against the water, watching the hotel. INT. HOTEL ROOM - DAWN Holmes withdraws from the window , looks at the sleeping Gabrielle, then casually swings the parasol, hitting a metal lamp-shade overhead. Gabrielle sits up abruptly in bed, clutching her negligee around her.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Sorry about that. But as long as you're up -- what is the German word for castle? Schloss, isn't it?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (carefully) I think so.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: And how would you say under the castle? Unter das Schlss? Or die Schloss?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I don't know. My German isn't that good.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (indicating) Your Trappist friends are out there waiting to hear from you -- it's a chilly morning -- we don't want to keep them standing around too long, do we, Fraulein Hoffmanstal? (Gabrielle looks at him without answering) Come now. It's too late to play cat and mouse.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (flatly) Unter dem Schloss.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Thank you. (holding out parasol) Here's your signalling device -- it's a bit damp, I'm afraid -- would you care to let them know where they can find the submersible? (Gabrielle makes no move to take the parasol) No? Then I'll just have to do it myself. (moving toward window) I only hope my Morse code is adequate to the occasion. Keeping well to one side of the open window, he extends the parasol outside, opens it, starts sending out a series of long and short signals. LAKEFRONT - DAWN von Tirpitz and the other monks strain their eyes in the direction of the hotel. HOTEL - FROM MONKS' ANGLE - DAWN Outside the hotel window, Gabrielle's parasol can be seen flashing the message UNTER DEM SCHLOSS in Morse code -- but it is not apparent that Holmes is doing the signalling. INT. HOTEL ROOM - DAWN As Holmes continues opening and closing the parasol, Gabrielle gets out of bed, comes up beside him. Holmes finishes the message, shuts the parasol, draws it back into the room. Then he looks out the window. LAKEFRONT - FROM HOLMES' ANGLE - DAWN The monks turn away from the hotel, and with von Tirpitz in the lead, move off along the shore. INT. HOTEL ROOM - DAWN Holmes steps back from the window, faces Gabrielle.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: : EXT. CALEDONIAN HOTEL - DAWN The gig, with the quide driving and Holmes beside him, comes up the driveway, stops in front of the entrance. Holmes hops down, and twirling Gabrielle's parasol in his hand, walks into the hotel. INT. HOTEL ROOM - DAWN In the half-light, Gabrielle can be seen asleep in her bed. She is wearing the pink negligee with the maribou feathers, which has slipped halfway off her shoulders. The other bed has not been slept in. The door from the corridor opens and Holmes steps in, carrying the parasol.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Well, it's up to the good monks now. You can consider your part of the mission accomplished, Fraulein Hoffmanstal.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You're all wrong about me.   My name isn't Hoffmanstal.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It isn't?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's von Hoffmanstal.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I stand corrected.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (glancing toward window) I suppose once they're in the castle... It must amuse you, Mr. Holmes, Trappists walking into a trap.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's more amusing than that. Once in the castle, they will encounter surprisingly little resistance -- it will take but a small bottle of chloroform to overcome the guards.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (skeptically) You mean you're going to let them have the air-pump?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Better than that. We're going to let them have the submersible. They will find it with its engines running, all set to go. I assume they're all expert sailors? And since there is a German battleship cruising off the coast of Scotland, I expect they'll try to sail it out of the lock and rendezvous at sea.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Did you say try to?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I would suggest you get your things together. Mycroft will be here to take you into custody. He opens her suitcase, which is on the baggage rack at the foot of the bed. Gabrielle watches him for a beat, then crosses to the wardrobe, starts taking her clothes out.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I never had you fooled for a moment, did I? You knew right from the beginning -- when the cabbie brought me to Baker Street.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Let me see -- not quite that soon. He stretches out on the bed.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's so funny. I asked for this assignment, you know. I was scheduled to go to Japan, but I couldn't resist the challenge of coming up against the best. I'm sorry I didn't give you a closer game.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Close enough.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You're just being kind.   I failed miserably.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We all have occasional failures. Fortunately, Dr. Watson never writes about mine.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Holmes!   Holmes! INT. HOTEL ROOM - DAY Bright sunlight now floods the room.   Gabrielle, fully dressed, is standing in front of the  mirror, putting on her hat. Her packed bag has been set   out in the middle of the room, and resting on it is the  parasol. The door bursts open and Watson dashes in.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Holmes! In his haste he trips over the bag, goes down. As he picks himself up again, Gabrielle points toward the balcony. EXT. BALCONY - HOTEL - DAY Holmes is leaning against the parapet, scanning the lake through his telescope. Watson appears through the open French window behind him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (excitedly) Holmes, I saw it again -- that thing -- it came from the castle -- it's out there
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: : INT. HOTEL CORRIDOR - DAY Watson, back in his valet's outfit again, comes bounding down the narrow stairs from the attic, races toward the door of Holmes' room.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: - THROUGH TELESCOPE - DAY A trial of bubbles is moving along the surface. Suddenly there is a muffled explosion from below, and a geyser of water shoots up into the air. EXT. BALCONY - HOTEL - DAY Holmes slowly lowers the telescope.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It was out there. Now it's gone.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Gone?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Forever.   Look for yourself. LOCH NESS - THROUGH TELESCOPE - DAY There is a great turbulence in the water. Up to the surface pops the bottle of christening champagne, with rope and ribbons still attached. Then a copy of the Bible pops up. EXT. BALCONY - HOTEL - DAY WATSON A bottle of champagne?... and a Bible?...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That's all that's left of H.M.S. Jonah. He steps through the window as a puzzled Watson lowers the telescope. INT. HOTEL ROOM - DAY Watson follows Holmes in from the balcony.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It would seem that somebody carelessly loosened the bolts of the submersible. What a fitting end for Trappists -- now they are resting in eternal silence at the bottom of the lake.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (to Gabrielle) Do you know what he's talking about? Through the open doorway comes Mycroft.   In the corridor behind him is one of his aides.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Fraulein von Hoffmanstal?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yes, Mr. Holmes. I'm all ready.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: If there's one thing I like about the Prussians, it's their punctuality.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: If there's one thing I dislike about the British, it's their climate. I understand your jails are quite damp -- and your heating facilities totally inadequate.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: They are. But you're not going to jail. You're going back to Germany.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Germany?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You will be conducted to the Swiss-German border, and be exchanged for one of our agents -- a man named Ibbetson.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Thank you.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Don't thank me. Thank my brother.      It was his idea. Gabrielle looks at Holmes, but he avoids her eyes.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (to Gabrielle) Frankly, I think we are making a very poor deal. You much better than most operatives working for British intelligence. (turning to Holmes) Don't you agree, Sherlock?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (with a small but gallant bow to Gabrielle) And better than some consulting detectives. Mycroft signals to his aide, who comes in from the corridor and picks up Gabrielle's bag.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (to Gabrielle) Shall we?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (reaching for parasol) I'll take that. (to Holmes and Watson) Gentlemen. She turns and walks out the door, Mycroft following. Watson's bewilderment has now reached monumental proportions.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (folding his arms) All right, Holmes -- you don't have to explain anything to me, if you don't want to.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I appreciate that, Watson.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: After all, I'm only your official biographer -- HOLMES Anyway, I don't think she'd care to have this story spread all over Strand Magazine.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The public has a right to know these things. If she's a German spy, why should we concern ourselves about her feelings? Holmes crosses to a small window overlooking the courtyard of the hotel, opens it, looks out. EXT. HOTEL - DAY Mycroft's aide comes out of the hotel with Gabrielle's suitcase, loads it into an open carriage waiting in front of the entrance. Gabrielle emerges, carrying her parasol, and accompanied by Mycroft. He helps her into the carriage, gets in beside her.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . The aide joins the coachman, and the carriage drives off. Gabrielle does not look back toward the hotel. EXT. SMALL WINDOW - HOTEL - DAY Holmes is framed in the open window, watching the carriage. Watson comes up behind him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: If I promised not to write a word about it, would you enlighten me? As your friend -- as your valet -- HOLMES Quiet. I'm trying to read a personal message.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: A message? EXT. DRIVEWAY - DAY The carriage is moving away from the hotel. Gabrielle has her parasol over her shoulder, and it opens and closes, opens and closes. GABRIELLE - IN MOVING CARRIAGE - DAY She continues to signal with the parasol, unnoticed by Mycroft. EXT. SMALL WINDOW - HOTEL - DAY Watson is straining forward to see out the window.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What is she saying?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (slowly) Auf Wiedersehn.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Auf Weider---? The nerve!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . EXT. DRIVEWAY - DAY The carriage disappears down an avenue of trees, Gabrielle's parasol still flashing its message.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (holding up envelope) H'mmm. A letter from the Diogenes Club.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Maybe Mycroft is putting you up for membership.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: If only to have the distinct pleasure of blackballing his brother. He has slit open the envelope. Watson watches him curiously as he reads the letter, but Holmes' face remains expressionless. Slowly he puts down the letter, rises, crosses to the window, stands there staring out into the wintry street.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Aren't you going to finish your breakfast? Holmes doesn't answer. Watson takes a lump of sugar out of the bowl with a pair of tongs, drops it into his coffee.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . Then glancing over his shoulder to make sure Holmes isn't watching, he swivels the letter around with the tongs. It is written on Diogenes Club stationery, and reads: 9th December, 1888 Dear Sherlock, My sources in Tokyo inform me that Ilse von Hoffmanstal was arrested last week by the Japanese counter-intelligence service for spying on naval installations in Yokohama harbour. After a secret trial, she was summarily executed by a firing squad. It might interest you to know that The page ends at this point. Watson turns the sheet of paper over with the tongs. The letter continues on the other side. she had been living in Japan these past few months under the name of Mrs. Ashdown. Sincerely, Mycroft Watson looks toward Holmes, who is still standing with his back to the room, gets up from the table.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Holmes -- I'm terribly sorry about this.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (quietly, without turning) Where is it, Watson?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (after a beat) In the files. May to July, 1885. Holmes turns to the bookshelves above the desk.   From a row of similar volumes, he slides out the three  files marked MAY, JUNE, and JULY 1885. Actually, it's   the medical bag, standing on end, with the spines of  three volumes pasted on the bottom.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You're getting better.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . He sets the bag down on the desk, opens it, takes out a bottle of cocaine. Watson watches him with compassion as he crosses to his bedroom with his cocaine, goes in, shuts the door. Footsteps are heard hurrying up the stairs, and after a moment there is a knock on the door. Watson approaches the door, opens it to reveal INSPECTOR LESTRADE -- a short, nervous man whose features are sharper than his mind. He is wearing an overcoat, his bowler is in his hands, and his fingers are drumming on the crown.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Good morning, Watson. (stepping in) Just happened to be in the neighborhood, and I thought -- WATSON What is it this time, Inspector Lestrade?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We've had three rather nasty murders in Whitechapel. All ladies of  easy virtue. You may read something about it -- the newspapers are referring to the killer as Jack the Ripper.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yes, I think I have.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Some of us at Scotland Yard were wondering if perhaps Mr. Holmes would be willing to -- WATSON (a glance toward the bedroom) I'm sorry, Lestrade. But at the moment, Holmes is working on another problem.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (trying to hide his disappointment) Oh... Well, I just thought it was the kind of case that might interest him. I dare say we can solve it without his help.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: : EXT. BAKER STREET - DAY There is snow on the ground, and drifts of it piled up along the curbs. Traffic is light. Householders are shovelling the snow off the sidewalks, and pedestrians are hurrying along bundled up against the cold. INT. LIVING ROOM - 221B BAKER STREET - DAY Holmes, in his dressing gown, and Watson, in his smoking jacket, are at the breakfast table. There is snow on the window-sills, and a cozy fire is burning in the grate. Watson is reading the morning paper. Holmes is sorting through his mail.
dialogue.name: dialogue
